tools.name: ACCESS-OM2
tools.one_line_profile: Global coupled ocean-sea ice model configuration and code
tools.detailed_description: ACCESS-OM2 is a global coupled ocean-sea ice model that combines the MOM5.1 ocean model and the CICE5.1.2 sea ice model, coupled via OASIS3-MCT. It is designed for climate research and simulation.

tools.name: LBLRTM
tools.one_line_profile: Line-By-Line Radiative Transfer Model
tools.detailed_description: LBLRTM is an accurate and efficient line-by-line radiative transfer model derived from the FASCODE algorithm. It is used for calculating spectral radiance and transmittance in the atmosphere.

tools.name: monoRTM
tools.one_line_profile: Monochromatic Radiative Transfer Model
tools.detailed_description: monoRTM is a radiative transfer model designed to process a small number of monochromatic frequencies, suitable for microwave regions and laser applications, utilizing the same physics as LBLRTM.

tools.name: CRITERIA-3D
tools.one_line_profile: Three-dimensional agro-hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: CRITERIA-3D is a three-dimensional agro-hydrological model for small catchments, simulating water balance, nitrogen flow, and heat transport in soil and vegetation systems.

tools.name: F0AM
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for 0-D Atmospheric Modeling
tools.detailed_description: F0AM is a MATLAB-based framework for zero-dimensional atmospheric chemistry box modeling, designed to simulate chemical kinetics and photolysis in the atmosphere.

tools.name: AtChem2
tools.one_line_profile: Atmospheric chemistry box-model for the MCM
tools.detailed_description: AtChem2 is a Fortran-based atmospheric chemistry box model that uses the Master Chemical Mechanism (MCM) to simulate complex chemical processes in the atmosphere.

tools.name: DLESyM
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning Earth System Model software
tools.detailed_description: DLESyM is a software package for training, running, and analyzing Deep Learning Earth System Models, facilitating the integration of AI into climate modeling.

tools.name: SeaFreeze
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and ice
tools.detailed_description: SeaFreeze is a package for computing the thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and various ice polymorphs (Ih, III, V, VI) over a wide range of pressures and temperatures.

tools.name: C-Coupler2
tools.one_line_profile: Community coupler for model coupling and nesting
tools.detailed_description: C-Coupler2 is a flexible and user-friendly community coupler designed for coupling and nesting various earth system model components.

tools.name: CABLE
tools.one_line_profile: Community Atmosphere Biosphere Land Exchange model
tools.detailed_description: CABLE is a land surface model used to simulate the exchange of momentum, energy, water, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere.

tools.name: paleoToolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Paleoclimate tools for CESM
tools.detailed_description: paleoToolkit provides a set of tools and utilities for configuring and running the Community Earth System Model (CESM) for paleoclimate simulations.

tools.name: OceanMesh2D
tools.one_line_profile: Two-dimensional triangular mesh generator for ocean models
tools.detailed_description: OceanMesh2D is a MATLAB-based mesh generation tool designed to build unstructured triangular meshes for coastal ocean circulation models like ADCIRC, FVCOM, and SCHISM.

tools.name: CICE
tools.one_line_profile: Community Sea Ice Model
tools.detailed_description: CICE is a computationally efficient sea ice model that simulates the growth, melt, and movement of sea ice, widely used in global climate and earth system models.

tools.name: ACCESS-OM2 (COSIMA)
tools.one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM2 ocean-sea ice model
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the source code and configurations for the ACCESS-OM2 global ocean-sea ice coupled model, maintained by the COSIMA community.

tools.name: ACCESS-OM3
tools.one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM3 ocean-sea ice-wave model
tools.detailed_description: ACCESS-OM3 is the next-generation global coupled model including ocean (MOM6), sea ice (CICE6), and waves (WW3), developed by the COSIMA community.

tools.name: cice5-access
tools.one_line_profile: ACCESS configuration of CICE5 sea ice model
tools.detailed_description: This is a clone of the Los Alamos CICE sea ice model (version 5.1.2) adapted with drivers for the ACCESS climate model framework.

tools.name: cosima-cookbook
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for analyzing ocean-sea ice model output
tools.detailed_description: The COSIMA Cookbook is a Python framework for indexing, querying, and analyzing output data from ocean and sea ice models, specifically designed for the ACCESS-OM2 suite.

tools.name: regional-mom6
tools.one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 configuration generator
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for automatically generating regional configurations for the Modular Ocean Model 6 (MOM6), simplifying the setup of regional ocean simulations.

tools.name: CrocoDash
tools.one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 setup package for CESM
tools.detailed_description: CrocoDash is a software package designed to facilitate the setup and configuration of regional MOM6 ocean models within the Community Earth System Model (CESM) framework.

tools.name: RavenHydroFramework
tools.one_line_profile: Raven Hydrological Modelling Framework
tools.detailed_description: Raven is a flexible hydrological modelling framework that allows for the discretization of watersheds and the simulation of hydrological processes using various algorithms.

tools.name: RavenPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Raven hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: RavenPy is a Python wrapper that facilitates the setup, execution, and analysis of the Raven hydrological modelling framework, enabling easier integration into Python workflows.

tools.name: Subzero.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Element Sea Ice Model in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Subzero.jl is a native Julia implementation of a Discrete Element Method (DEM) sea ice model, designed for simulating sea ice dynamics and mechanics.

tools.name: CHM
tools.one_line_profile: Canadian Hydrological Model
tools.detailed_description: The Canadian Hydrological Model (CHM) is a multi-scale, multi-physics hydrological model designed for cold-region hydrological simulations, focusing on snow and mountain hydrology.

tools.name: SCOPE
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation model for radiative transfer, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes
tools.detailed_description: SCOPE (Soil Canopy Observation, Photochemistry and Energy fluxes) is a vertical integrated radiative transfer and energy balance model. It simulates the transfer of radiation, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes in vegetation and soil.

tools.name: pangu-weather-verify
tools.one_line_profile: Validation tool for Pangu Weather Forecasting Model
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to validate the Pangu Weather Forecasting Model against real-world meteorological observations, facilitating the assessment of AI-based weather model performance.

tools.name: ClimaCore.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamical core for CliMA Earth system models
tools.detailed_description: ClimaCore.jl provides the dynamical core components for the Climate Machine (CliMA) Earth system model, handling the discretization and solving of fluid dynamics equations on the sphere.

tools.name: ClimaDiagnostics.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Diagnostics framework for CliMA simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework to define, compute, and output observables and statistics from CliMA simulations, enabling analysis of model outputs.

tools.name: ClimaSeaIce.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sea ice simulation model for Earth system modeling
tools.detailed_description: Provides coupled and stand-alone simulations of sea ice thermodynamics and dynamics for Earth system modeling applications within the CliMA ecosystem.

tools.name: ClimateMachine.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Earth System Model that learns from data
tools.detailed_description: Climate Machine is a next-generation Earth System Model (ESM) designed to automatically learn from data, integrating physics-based modeling with data-driven approaches.

tools.name: Insolation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solar radiation and geometry calculator for climate modeling
tools.detailed_description: Calculates solar radiation and solar geometry, including zenith angle, azimuth angle, and insolation at the top of the atmosphere, specifically for climate science and Earth system modeling.

tools.name: RRTMGP.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Radiative Transfer Model for General Circulation Models
tools.detailed_description: A Julia implementation of the Rapid and accurate Radiative Transfer Model for GCMs (RRTMGP), used for computing radiative fluxes in atmospheric models.

tools.name: SurfaceFluxes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Surface flux computation library for Earth system models
tools.detailed_description: A package for computing surface fluxes of heat, moisture, and momentum between the atmosphere, ocean, and land components of Earth system models.

tools.name: climt
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based climate modelling toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for building and running climate models using Python. It provides a modular framework for combining different physical components and dynamical cores.

tools.name: climate-ref
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid Evaluation Framework for CMIP simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for the rapid evaluation of CMIP (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project) simulations, facilitating the assessment of climate model performance.

tools.name: qgs
tools.one_line_profile: Quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model
tools.detailed_description: A 2-layer quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model implemented in Python, capable of coupling with simple land or shallow-water ocean components for studying atmospheric dynamics.

tools.name: MetaProteomeAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization software for metaproteomics data
tools.detailed_description: MetaProteomeAnalyzer (MPA) is a software tool for analyzing and visualizing mass spectrometry-based metaproteomics data, supporting protein identification and quantification.

tools.name: satellite-image-super-resolution
tools.one_line_profile: Super Resolution Imaging System for Satellite Imagery
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end workflow and model system leveraging Deep Transfer Learning and Computer Vision to perform super-resolution on satellite imagery, specifically for assessing climate action interventions.

tools.name: CryoGrid3
tools.one_line_profile: Land surface model for permafrost environments
tools.detailed_description: A one-dimensional land surface model dedicated to simulating ground temperatures and thermal processes in permafrost environments.

tools.name: CryoGridCommunity
tools.one_line_profile: Community version of the CryoGrid permafrost model
tools.detailed_description: The community version of CryoGrid, a numerical model designed to investigate land surface processes and ground thermal regimes in permafrost environments.

tools.name: BG_Flood

tools.detailed_description: A numerical model for simulating shallow water hydrodynamics on the GPU, designed for simulating inundation events such as river floods, storm surges, or tsunamis.

tools.name: pywatershed

tools.detailed_description: A hydrologic model implemented in Python, designed to simulate watershed processes and support hydrologic research and analysis.

tools.name: NWPeval

tools.name: DeepSpark

tools.name: E3SM
